channel.title: Resizing an image
channel.description:
Is there a program out there that can resize an image, to the dimensions I tell it? Let's say I have an image, and I know the distance between 2 points. So I tell the program what the distance between those 2 points is, and I tell it what distance it has to be. It then calculates what scale it is and then resizes the complete image. I hope that made sense.
Anyways, thanks in advance.

item.title: Resizing an image
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’ll print it out and see. Thanks for resizing it! If it’s not good, can I ask you to do it again? I’ll edit this post to tell you if it is good or not.

Edit: Yes! It’s the right size! Thanks for doing this. By the way, how did you do it?

Read full topic

item.title: Resizing an image
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Well here it is. I added 2 scales, the horizontal one is 17 1/4 inch or 43.8 cm. The vertical one is 32.5 cm.

item.title: Resizing an image
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Problem is, It does resize it but only on one page, so I have a small part of it and the rest disapears. And there is only one page, but it has to resize it to multiple pages.

Read full topic

item.title: Resizing an image
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Yea well, it’s a construction drawing that has to be quite precise, and resizing that way will probably result in atleast a cm off, but I can try. Anyways, if someone knows a different way, please tell.

PS. precise as in I’m going to stick it to a piece of wood and cut it out.

Read full topic
